etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish یكیدن (yeñiden), from *yaŋï-dan /*yaŋa-dan (“again, anew”), originally ablative of Proto-Turkic *yaŋï /*yaŋa (“new”).
Cognate with Tatar яңадан (yañadan),
Bashkir яңынан (yañınan),
Kyrgyz жаңыдан (jaŋıdan),
Kumyk янгыдан (yañıdan),
Uzbek yangidan,
Kazakh жаңадан (jañadan), etc.
